item.title: Driving Nails
item.description:
[caption id="attachment_1722" align="alignright" width="300" caption="Orin Zebest on Flickr"][/caption]

When I was a kid, I used to read a lot of morality tales, and one of my favorite was about the effects of harsh words and the effectiveness of apology. Here it is, as best I can remember.

A young boy had a bad temper. He would yell at his sister and his mother, and was very impertinent to his father. Generally, he was a pain, and he was pretty much immune to all forms of discipline and punishment, though his parents tried their best.
